title: Step Four
subtitle: We made a searching and fearless moral inventory of ourselves.

questions.prompt: Why am I working a Fourth Step?
Do I have fears about doing a Fourth Step? What are they?
What might I find if I look beneath the anger or fear or pain that's been covering everything up? What defects might be revealed?
How have the defects in my character affected my life? How have they affected the lives of those around me?
Do I think I'll be able to find some patterns in my behavior by doing a Fourth Step? What do I think those patterns might be?
List the people, institutions, and principles with which I am angry. What, exactly, about each, do I resent?
Looking at each resentment, where was I selfish, self-seeking, dishonest, or frightened?
Referring to each resentment, how has holding on to it affected me? Has it affected my self-esteem, my pocketbook, my personal relationships, my ambitions, my emotional security, or my sex conduct?
What part have I played in each of my resentments? Have I been selfish and dishonest? How so?
Have I been inconsiderate? Unkind? What have I done?
Have I been intolerant and quick to find fault with others? What have I found fault with?
Have I been too demanding? Of whom have I demanded too much? In what ways?
How often have I insisted that things be my way?
Have I held unrealistic expectations of other people? What have they been?
What do I fear? Make a list.
Why do I have these fears?
Where have I been selfish and dishonest in relation to my fears?
Do I rely on myself rather than a Power greater than myself?
How have my fears affected my self-esteem, my pocketbook, my personal relationships, my ambitions, my emotional security, or my sex conduct?

Am I afraid of responsibility, commitment, being alone, being found out, being rejected, being homeless, not having my needs met, the unknown, going to prison, or being free? How have these fears affected me?
Am I afraid of growing up and living a responsible, productive life? Am I afraid of failing? Success? Intimacy? Am I afraid of being hurt? How have these fears affected me?
Do I accept other people as they are? Have I ever thought that life would be better if only other people were different? Explain.
Have I been intolerant and refused to allow others the right to their own opinions, thoughts, and beliefs? Explain.
Have I always needed to be right? How did this affect my relationships?
Have I used self-pity to get attention? Describe.
Did I ever lie or stretch the truth to make myself look more pathetic? Explain.
Did I make others feel guilty by feeling sorry for myself? Describe.
Have I been trustworthy? Where was I not?
Do I usually think of myself as better than everyone around me? How has this affected my relationships?
Do I usually think of myself as less than everyone around me? How has this affected my relationships?
Have I tended to idealize other people? How did they turn out to be different from my idealized image of them? What happened to those relationships?
Have I tended to seek approval from others? What happened to my relationships with those from whom I sought approval?
Where have I been selfish in my sexual relationships? Describe.
Have I been dishonest? How?
Have I been inconsiderate? Explain.
In what ways have I used others? Have I traded sex for other things I wanted?
Have I manipulated and lied to meet my own sexual needs? Describe.
Did I really care about the other person? In what ways did I demonstrate my caring?
Did I feel either better than or less than my sexual partners? Explain.
Did I sell myself short, settling for much less than I deserved?
Did I end up feeling worthless, used, and abused?
Have my relationships ended in pain and unhappiness?
What part have I played in my unhealthy relationships? What character defects have I had in common in these relationships? How did they affect me?
In what ways have I tried to keep things secret? Why did I do this?
Have I blamed others for the things I did? In what situations?
Have I lied to myself and others? About what?
Have I been a phony? Have I put on an act when I've been around certain people? What act was it?
Have I felt inadequate and insecure? How have these feelings affected my life?
Have I tried to compensate for my feelings of inadequacy by bragging, lying, stealing, using drugs, or showing off in some other way? Explain.
Have I been selfish and self-centered, always wanting things my way? In what ways?
Have I tried to control others? How did I do that?
Have I often felt justified in doing things that would ordinarily make me feel ashamed? When?
Have I hidden behind a wall of anger, self-righteousness, or sarcasm? Explain.
Have any character defects contributed to a pattern in my life? What are they? What is the pattern?
Do I have any destructive habits? What are they? How have they harmed me?
What positive character traits do I have? (For example: Am I generous? Caring? Loyal? Open-minded? Honest? Trustworthy?)
Have I identified any patterns of selfishness, dishonesty, or fear? What are they?
What defects have shown up again and again in each part of my life?
What does it mean to be searching?
What does it mean to be fearless?
How is honesty an important part of a Fourth Step?
How can a Fourth Step help me develop self-awareness?
Why is thoroughness important in doing a Fourth Step?
How have I demonstrated courage by doing this Fourth Step?
What feelings have come up while doing this inventory? Am I afraid of sharing with another person? Why?
Am I willing to go on to the Fifth Step?
What is my understanding of Step Four?
How has my prior knowledge and experience affected my work on this step?
